keywords.term: Burns, Pat Moyer, William H. Moors, A. N. Sproul, G. C. Ayres, A. Reeves Matthew, H.M.
King County, Washington Seattle, Washington Olympia, Washington

org.orgName: Circuit Court of the United States, District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: I N T H E U N I T E D S T A T E S C I R C U I T C O U R T,
FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the matter of the application: of Pat Burns for the Writ of Habeas Corpus: P E T I T I O N and Relief thereon.
To the Honorable Circuit Court of the United States, for the District of Washington, and to the Judges thereof:
Your petitioner, Pat Burns, alleges and shows:
That he is a citizen and a resident of the United States, residing in the County of King, at the City of Seattle, in the State of Washington.

That he is now being unlawfully detained and unlawfully held in custody by William H. Moyer, Sheriff of King County, and, against his wish, is being held by the said Moyer under threats of the said Moyer, as Sheriff of King County, to transport him, the Petitioner, to the State Penitentary at Walla Walla, there to be confined for the period of five years under an alleged process and authority as herein- after more fully stated; and that the said Moyer threatens to carry said incarceration into immediate execution.

Your Petitioner alleges that the said threat and attempt to imprision him as aforesaid is set for and arranged to be, as your Petitioner understands, at once, and that the same is wholly without authority of law and without the jurisdiction of any court and contrary to the Laws and contrary to the rights of your Petitioner as a citizen of the United States under the constitution and law as will more fully appear in the matters hereinafter set forth.

Your Petitioner informs the court that on or about the 13 day of June, 1897 he was attempted to be charged by the State of Washington, by pretended information of the crime of grand larceny. and that your Petitioner was tried upon said alleged information upon issue joined in the Superior Court of King County, State of Washington, and was in said Court by virtue of said alleged information found guilty and sentenced by said court to 5 years in the Penitentiary of the State of washington, and that Your Petitioner perfected an appeal from said judgment which has been by the Supreme Court of the State of Washington affirmed upon the errors therein assigned, and that said charge of grand larceny of which your Petitioner was convicted was and is a felony, and that Your Petitioner was not proceeded against by an indictment by any grand Jury of said Court; but, on the contrary, upon information, which information was an attempt to comply with the Constitution and Laws of the State of Washington, but that the same was not verified as by law required; and your Pettioner further states, that the provision of the said Constitution of the State of Washington and the laws enacted there- under whereby and upon which said attemped information was predicated were, and are, in derogation of and against the constitutional liber- ties granted your petitioner by the Constiution of the United States, and that the Honorable Court so trying and sentencing your Petitioner was wholly without jurisdiction and all of its acts in the premises were absolutely void: and that said court nort the judge thereof had any jurisdiction or authority to make any order of imprisonment for the imprisonment of your Petitioner in said cause; tthat notwithstand- ing all of the objections presented before said court and said Judge, your Petitioner was nevertheless ordered to be incarcerated as afore- said; that there was no authority for such order and the same is wholly contrary to the laws of the United States and of the Con- stitution of the United States and the rights of your Petitioner as a citizen of the United States,

WHEREFORE, your Petitioner asks that upon due hearing of the cause and upon examination of the records of the cause and the evidence in the cause, your Honor will make an order discharging your Petitioner and that your Honor will grant unto your Petitioner a Writ of Habeas Corpus commanding your Petitioner to be brought before the Court at such time and place as to the Court may be convenient for the hearing of the matters and things herein alleged by your Petitioner, and that your Honor do issue a Writ of certiotati to the Superior Court of the State of Washington for King County ordering to be duly certified to the Court the records of this said cause, particularily the alleged information, the verdict, the judgment and warrant of imprisonment made in the premises; that your Honor and the Court may be informed in the premises, and that upon such records and upon hearing of the cause such other and further orders shall be made in the premises as will be right and proper, And your Peitioner will ever pray.

Pat Burns, being first duly sworn, on oath says: That he is the Petitioner herein; that he knows the matters and things set forth in the petition, and of the matters of his own knowledge says they are true, and the other matters of law he is advised by his counsel that they are true and therefore believes the whole of said petition to betrue.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 12th day of July, A.D. 1898,
Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Olympia
United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington.
In the matter of application of Pat Burns for Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Clerk of the above entitled Court:
You will please enter my appearance as attorney for applicant in this matter
NOTICE-- Attorneys will please endorse their own Filings. Rule 47.
United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington.
In the matter of this application of Patrick Burns for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
To the Clerk of the above entitled Court:
You will please enter of withdrawl and dismissal of this application for a writ in the aforementioned matters on part of applicant and petitioner
In the matter of the application of Pat Burns for writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed FILED IN THE U. S. Circuit Court, 189 DIST. OF WASHINGTON.
